user_message:
<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 2.2 is: A project shall not contain dead code.
Any operation that is executed but whose removal would not affect program behaviour constitutes dead code. Notes:
1. The behaviour of an embedded sytem is often determined not just by the nature of its actions, but also by the time at which they occur.
2. unreachable code is not dead code, as it cannot be executed.
3.Initialization is not the same as an assignment operation and is therfore not a candidate for dead code.
</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of producer_thread:
```c
static void *producer_thread(void *arg)
{
	(void)arg;
	metal_mutex_acquire(&lock);
	while (counter == COUNTER_MAX)
		metal_condition_wait(&nfull_condv, &lock);
	counter++;
	metal_condition_signal(&nempty_condv);
	metal_mutex_release(&lock);

	return NULL;
}
```
</target_code>
<additional code>Here are the definitions of symbols that are related to the target function producer_thread:
static unsigned int counter
...
#define COUNTER_MAX 10
...
METAL_MUTEX_DEFINE(lock)
...
static struct metal_condition nfull_condv = METAL_CONDITION_INIT
...
static struct metal_condition nempty_condv = METAL_CONDITION_INIT
...
static void *consumer_thread(void *arg)
{
	(void)arg;
	metal_mutex_acquire(&lock);
	while (!counter)
		metal_condition_wait(&nempty_condv, &lock);
	counter--;
	metal_condition_signal(&nfull_condv);
	metal_mutex_release(&lock);

	return NULL;
}
</additional code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
explanation: The two occurrences of the unused-parameter cast (void)arg; are flagged because they are executed no-op statements whose removal would not affect runtime behaviour (they exist solely to silence unused-parameter warnings). Other code fragments are not reported because they perform synchronization or state changes that clearly affect program behaviour and therefore are not candidates for dead code without additional context: - counter and COUNTER_MAX: the counter variable and its limit are used by both threads; increments/decrements and the loop conditions change program state. - metal_mutex_acquire(&lock) / metal_mutex_release(&lock): mutex operations control concurrency and cannot be removed without changing behaviour. - metal_condition_wait(...) / metal_condition_signal(...): condition variable operations affect thread coordination and timing; removing them would alter behaviour. - counter++ / counter--: modify shared state and are essential. - METAL_MUTEX_DEFINE(lock) and static struct metal_condition ... = METAL_CONDITION_INIT: these are declarations/initializations (note: initialization is not considered an assignment or dead code per MISRA Note 3). - return NULL;: required to supply the thread-return value for the thread function signature; removing it would change control flow/definedness. Without broader build/run context (e.g., whether certain threads are ever created or certain macros expand to no-ops), no other statements can safely be classified as dead code, so they are not listed.
